content: Is there any particular incompatibility with LLVM 9 that motivated dropping it? For now we need LLVM 9 support to continue using ASan on mixed Rust/C++ binaries. I'm planning on maintaining this support internally and I was wondering if there are any problems I should be aware of.
asm! support partially landed in LLVM 10, I think, based on commentary on https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/83387
@Patrick Walton Is that an issue with ASan in general, or just because you're using a C++ toolchain based on LLVM 9 and it'll take time before that C++ toolchain can be upgraded?

Josh Triplett said:

Patrick Walton Is that an issue with ASan in general, or just because you're using a C++ toolchain based on LLVM 9 and it'll take time before that C++ toolchain can be upgraded?

The latter
